titleStmt.title: A declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament concerning His Majesties late proclamation threatning fire and sword to all inhabitants in the county of Oxford and Berks and parts adjacent, that will not bring in all their provisions for men and horse to the garrison of Oxford : with the resolution of both Houses thereupon for the hazard their lives and fortunes to prevent these miseries and secure those places and the whole kingdome.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

titleStmt.title: A declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament concerning His Majesties late proclamation threatning fire and sword to all inhabitants in the county of Oxford and Berks and parts adjacent, that will not bring in all their provisions for men and horse to the garrison of Oxford : with the resolution of both Houses thereupon for the hazard their lives and fortunes to prevent these miseries and secure those places and the whole kingdome.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

notesStmt.note: "By the King, a proclamation for the better preservation of the country and the garrison at Oxford, and securing of their corne, and other provisions of victuals, and food for men and horse" : p. 3-6.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
